business.headline: Rupee at strongest since October 2024 as it breaks 84/dollar markThis marks a nearly 2% weekly gain for the rupee, powered by a sustained rally in Indian equities and growing optimism over an early US-India trade deal under the Trump administration.

Zomato shares rise despite 78% drop in Q4 profit. Should you buy, hold or sell?Eternal posted revenue of Rs 5,830 crore, broadly in line with analyst estimates. EBITDA margin slipped to 1.2%—falling short of expectations—but the company managed to maintain stable contribution margins in both food delivery and quick commerce.
Adani Group stocks rise up to 5%. Here's whyAdani Enterprises' shares climbed more than 2% on Friday after the company reported an increase in its net profit for the January–March quarter.
Sensex gains 900 points. 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 867.48 points at 81,109.72 around 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 247.90 points to trade at 24,582.10.

Sensex, Nifty soar as trade deal hopes lift sentiment; FII buying boosts rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex went past the 81,000 mark while NSE Nifty50 was close to surpassing 24,600 level as Dalal Street surged in early trade.

Ather Energy IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing dateThe total number of bids received was 7,67,49,068 against the offer of 5,11,22,370 shares. Through the IPO, Ather Energy raised Rs 2,980.76 crore.

Stock market opening today: Will Sensex, Nifty rise or fall on May 2?In the last two sessions, both Sensex and Nifty ended slightly lower. There was uncertainty among investors due to rising tension between India and Pakistan. However, markets are expected to start the day on a stronger note.

Stocks to watch: Eternal, Tata Motors, Adani Enterprises, Infosys, MahindraBoth the Sensex and Nifty ended slightly lower in the last session, as cautious sentiment prevailed among investors over rising India-Pakistan tension.

Air India expects $600 million in losses if Pak airspace shut for a year: ReportThe closure of Pakistani airspace for a year would result in losses of USD 600 million for the country's national carrier, Air India, news agency PTI reported, citing sources. The airline has sought the government's assistance to address the challenges.

RBI makes PRAVAAH portal mandatory for financial institutions starting May 1The PRAVAAH portal provides all necessary forms, along with simple instructions. Users can submit their application, track its progress, and even get alerts.
GST collections hit record Rs 2.37 lakh crore in April, up 12.6%In March, GST collections stood at Rs 1.96 lakh crore, showing a 9.9% rise from the same period last year.

Nithin Kamath exposes this scam using his name to dupe investors. Details hereZerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath has urged investors to stay alert, always check the source, and never act on random financial advice sent on messaging apps.

Adani Ports Q4 results: Net profit soars 50%, revenue up 23%The company reported a 50% rise in its consolidated net profit, which stood at Rs 3,023 crore. This is an increase from Rs 2,025 crore reported in the same quarter last year.

From ATM charges to LPG prices: 5 key financial changes to know in May 2025Starting May 1, taking cash out from an ATM after your free monthly limit will cost you Rs 23 per transaction, up from the current Rs 21.
Zomato Q4 earnings: What to expect from Eternal's January-March resultsAnalysts expect mixed numbers for the fourth quarter, mainly due to expected higher losses from its quick commerce arm, Blinkit.

'Gold doesn't always glitter': This CA's post might change your mindA CA pointed out a combination of global shocks, like COVID-19, wars, inflation fears, and central bank purchases, which all contributed to the price spike in the yellow metal since 2020.

'Deliberately false': Elon Musk slams report claiming Tesla looking to replace himElon Musk responded furiously on X, calling it "an EXTREMELY BAD BREACH OF ETHICS" and slamming the WSJ for "publishing a DELIBERATELY FALSE ARTICLE" despite receiving a prior denial from Tesla's board.

Vedanta Q4 profit more than doubles: Check price target, FY26 estimates and moreWith expansion projects nearing completion and deleveraging underway, analysts believe Vedanta is positioning itself for a stronger, leaner phase of growth.

New ITR Forms 1 and 4 notified for FY 2024-2025. Check key changes, who can fileITR-1, or Sahaj, is for resident individuals who have an overall income of not more than Rs 50 lakh a year and the income is from a salary or pension, single house property, or income like interest from bank deposits or fixed deposits.

Ather Energy IPO: Step-by-step guide to check allotment status. See latest GMPThe electric scooter maker's public offer was just fully subscribed by the end of the final day of bidding, suggesting investors were not keen to put their money on another EV scooter maker, after Ola Electric's shares have not performed well since its market debut.

Accounting lapse, high-profile exits: What's next for IndusInd Bank?As the dust settles on IndusInd Bank's derivatives debacle, the real test begins: can the bank restore trust, steady the ship, and convince investors it's back on course?

Coca-Cola sells record servings at Maha Kumbh. The final number may shock youWhile saints and seekers looked for divine blessings, the world's biggest beverage giant looked across the Ganga's banks and found its biggest crowd.

Sensex, Nifty holiday: Are stock markets open for trading today?There are also no market holidays in the months of June and July 2025, so investors can expect uninterrupted trading during this period.

After Mother Dairy, Amul hikes milk prices by Rs 2 per litreAfter Mother Dairy, Amul has also hiked the prices of its milk up to 2rs per litre. The new prices will come into effect from tomorrow, i.e., May 1.

'Cash is king,' says Mark Mobius amid trade war fears, backs India over ChinaVeteran investor Mark Mobius believes that the uncertainty around the trade wars makes it risky to invest right now. However, he does see hope in countries like India, which he says could benefit as global supply chains shift away from China.
Sensex closes 46 points lower, Nifty below 24,400; Bajaj twins fall 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 46.14 points to end at 80,242.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 1.75 points to close at 24,334.20.

Can gold retain its glitter as Dalal Street gets back its glow?Just a week ago, gold was trading at record levels due to global uncertainty. Concerns over trade tensions, US tariffs, and geopolitical issues had pushed investors towards gold, a common choice during uncertain times.

New wave of IPOs is coming. Is Dalal Street ready?Tata Capital, PhonePe, and Zepto are also said to be in the pipeline. Financial firms like HDB Financial Services and Hero FinCorp are planning to raise Rs 12,500 crore and Rs 3,668 crore, respectively.

Rakuten to invest over $100 million in India, plans to boost hiring by 8%Rakuten currently employs 4,000 people in India, 90% of whom are tech staff, and plans to recruit people who it considers "power users" of AI.

RBI raises ATM charges to Rs 23 from May 1: Know the details herePeople living in metro cities would get three free transactions per month, while those living in non-metro areas would get five free transactions per month.

Rupee jumps to highest level in 2025. Check factors behind strong rallyThe Indian rupee reached its highest level of 2025, driven by foreign inflows and exporter dollar sales. Optimism over US-India trade talks and a weakening US dollar further supported the currency's rally.

'If we look closely...': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu on finding rural talentZoho's CEO, Sridhar Vembu, believes that India's path to development must include creating jobs and opportunities in smaller towns and villages.

5 Adani stocks get new targets after Q4 results: What should investors do?With Gautam Adani-led Adani Enterprises Ltd set to announce its earnings report soon, stock brokerages have already reviewed the performance of five listed companies from the group and shared fresh price targets and advice for investors.

Varun Beverages Q4 net profit at Rs 726 crore; firm announces interim dividendThe company posted a net profit of Rs 726 crore, up 35% year-on-year, driven by higher volumes and peak-season demand. Revenue for the quarter came in at Rs 5,680 crore, a 29% jump YoY, slightly ahead of most analyst estimates.

Vivad Se Vishwas 2.0 deadline ends today: Last call to settle income tax disputesVivad Se Vishwas 2.0 is a dispute resolution scheme run by the Income Tax Department. It gives taxpayers a chance to settle ongoing tax-related cases by avoiding the prolonged litigation process and simply paying the disputed tax amount.

Akshaya Tritiya 2025: Is falling gold price an opportunity to buy more?Akshaya Tritiya is considered a good day to buy gold. But with gold prices now close to all-time highs, near Rs 96,000 per 10 grams, many buyers are thinking twice before making big purchases this year.
Ather Energy IPO ends today: Should you subscribe or avoid?Ather Energy is struggling to generate investor interest, with sluggish IPO subscription levels and a muted grey market premium.

Bajaj Finance shares tank over 5% after Q4 results. Buy, hold or sell?The stock reacted to a set of numbers that, while solid on paper, failed to match elevated market expectations. In the fourth quarter of FY25, Bajaj Finance reported a 19% year-on-year jump in net profit to Rs 4,546 crore, driven by a 22% rise in net interest income to Rs 9,807 crore.

Explained: Why Bajaj Finserv shares tumbled 6% after Q4 resultsIn its Q4FY25 earnings, Bajaj Finserv reported a 14% year-on-year (YoY) rise in both net profit and revenue, posting Rs 2,417 crore in profit and Rs 36,595 crore in revenue.

Gold price falls further as easing trade tensions dampen appealSpot gold was down 0.2% at $3,308.32 an ounce, as of 0242 GMT. US gold futures GCcv1 lost 0.5% to $3,317.50. The dollar edged 0.1% higher against a basket of currencies, making bullion more expensive for overseas buyers.

entertainment.headline: Allu Arjun recreates Pushpa pose, admits being 1st South star with six-pack absAllu Arjun was one of the chief guests at WAVES Summit 2025 on Thursday in Mumbai. The actor recreated his iconic Pushpa pose, which received cheers from audience.

HIT 3 vs Retro box office Day 1: Nani and Suriya's films make a roaring start 'HIT: The Third Case' and 'Retro' have taken over the box office in the South industry. Both films began on a solid note, with a double-digit opening, and are looking at fabulous first-weekend figures.

Has Sparsh Shrivastava faced bias due to TV background? Actor answersSparsh Shrivastava, known for his roles in 'Laapataa Ladies' and 'Dupahiya', has ventured into music with his single 'Ji Huzoor', showcasing his diverse talents. In an exclusive interview, he opened up about his TV stint, facing rejections and pursuing music seriously.

Assigning blame without proof...: Hania Aamir's dig at India over Pahalgam attackPakistani actor Hania Aamir, taking a swipe at India for holding Pakistan accountable for the Pahalgam attack, asserted that assigning blame without proof only 'deepens the divide'.

Raid 2 box office Day 1: Ajay Devgn's film opens strong, raises Bollywood's hopesAjay Devgn's 'Raid 2' has begun its box office journey on a fabulous note. The film received mixed reviews, but the audience gave it a positive chance to work well. It could be the first Bollywood film of the year to be looking at reaching the benchmark of Rs 100 crore in a week.

Ajith Kumar opens up about racing comeback and looking beyond films | ExclusiveAjith Kumar opened up about his dual career as a racing driver and team owner, revealing his passion for motorsports despite past challenges. He shared insights into his aspirations and the support he receives from family and teammates, in an exclusive chat with India Today.

British comedian Russell Brand to appear in London court today on rape chargesBritish actor-comedian Russell Brand will appear in a London court after being charged with rape and sexual assault in cases related to four women over two decades ago.

Mira Rajput lends helping hand to Deepika Padukone in adorable viral videoShahid Kapoor's wife Mira Rajput helped Deepika Padukone fix her dress at the WAVES summit 2025, held on Thursday in Mumbai. The viral video of the two from the event has emerged on social media.

Selena Gomez Reflects on Justin Bieber breakup and finding love with Benny BlancoSelena Gomez reflects on her journey of heartbreak following her breakup with Justin Bieber. Now engaged to Benny Blanco, she says she has found emotional peace, joy, and lasting love.

Jeremy Renner slams Disney over pay cut for Hawkeye Season 2 Jeremy Renner claims Disney offered him half the pay for Hawkeye Season 2 following his near-fatal accident, calling the offer insulting. Disney sources disputed his version but offered no details.

All about Met Gala 2025: Theme, dress code, and star co-chairsThe 2025 Met Gala returns May 5 with the theme "Superfine: Tailoring Black Style," honoring Black fashion. Co-chaired by celebrities, it celebrates heritage, history, and bold menswear creativity.

Diddy rejects plea deal, faces life sentence in federal sex trafficking trialSean "Diddy" Combs has rejected a federal plea deal and will face trial next week on sex trafficking and racketeering charges. He denies all allegations and pleads not guilty.

One Piece animator wants sound team of anime to be 'immediately fired'One Piece animator Sota Shigetsugu has sparked controversy by criticising the sound team for their 'unprofessional' work in the latest episode of the anime. The criticism comes after the release of Episode 1127, where the sound effects were deemed outdated and poorly executed.

Tourist Family review: Sasikumar-Simran film is all white and pure loveReleased-Thu May 01, 2025Tourist Family review: Director Abishan Jeevinth's 'Tourist Family' starring Sasikumar, Simran, Mithun Jai Shankar and Kamalesh, is a beautiful drama about humanity. It's also a brilliant example of what simple films can evoke in you.

Ajith Kumar reflects on life and retirement after Padma Bhushan honourTamil star Ajith Kumar, who recently received the Padma Bhushan, shared insights on his approach to life and retirement, emphasising the value of making the most of every moment.

Shah Rukh Khan weighs in on insider vs outsider debate: I have a problemShah Rukh Khan recently weighed in on the insider vs outsider debate at the WAVES Summit 2025. The actor mentioned how he has a problem with the distinction.

K-pop star Jackson Wang teams up with Diljit Dosanjh for new singleInternational pop star Jackson Wang and Indian music icon Diljit Dosanjh have joined forces for a new single. Titled 'BUCK', it is set to release on May 9.

Virat Kohli's birthday wish for his 'best half' Anushka Sharma is all things loveCricketer Virat Kohli wished his actor-wife Anushka Sharma with an adorable post on social media. He shared a beautiful picture of the couple on the special day.

Sonu Nigam brings up 'Pahalgam' during concert, feels 'threatened' by Kannada fanSinger Sonu Nigam was performing in Bengaluru when a fan started screaming, demanding a Kannada song. The singer paused the concert, addressed the incident, and also mentioned the ghastly Pahalgam terror attack.

general news.headline: 100 flights delayed, 4 dead due to strong winds as heavy rain batters Delhi-NCRDelhi-NCR was hit by heavy rainfall coupled with severe thunderstorms and gusty winds early on Friday. An orange alert is in place in the national capital, with flights being delayed due to the inclement weather conditions.

India's response to Pahalgam terror attack should avoid regional war: JD VanceUnderlining that India's response to last week's Pahalgam attack should avoid the risk of a broader regional conflict, US Vice President JD Vance hoped that Pakistan would work with India to track down terrorists who carried out the attack.

Shasthi Tharoor receives PM in Kerala, takes dig at 'dysfunctional' Delhi airportCongress MP Shashi Tharoor, a four-time lawmaker from Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram, said he "managed to land in time" to receive Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the city and slammed the Delhi airport for flight delays.

Rivers in Pakistan aren't drying yet. Here's whyOfficial data and satellite imagery processed by India Today's Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT) team suggest rivers allocated to Pakistan under the IWT – the Indus, Chenab, and Jhelum (collectively called Western rivers) – continued to flow their normal course and speed as of April 30.

Government fact-checks claims of Air Force officer's sacking over Pak war stanceThe government fact-checked claims by several pro-Pakistan social media accounts that said that Vice Chief of Air Staff Air Marshal Sujeet Pushpakar Dharkar was sacked for refusing to fight a war against Pakistan.

The airline has sought the government's assistance to address the challenges.

BJP's caste census strike: Why did Modi government make a U-turn?The Bharatiya Janata Party-led Centre has announced it will conduct a caste census in a decision that has surprised the Opposition and political analysts.
No need for strict schedule: WB Class 10 topper Adrita Sarkar shares study mantraAdrita Sarkar from Uttar Dinajpur has topped the WB Madhyamik 2025 exam with 99.43% and plans to pursue medicine.

Rupee at strongest since October 2024 as it breaks 84/dollar markThis marks a nearly 2% weekly gain for the rupee, powered by a sustained rally in Indian equities and growing optimism over an early US-India trade deal under the Trump administration.
Nepali student found dead in Bhubaneswar university hostel, 2nd case in 3 monthsPolice said the Nepali student was found hanging in her room around 7 pm in one of the girls' hostels.

Rohit Sharma out or not out vs RR? DRS decision sparks social media debateRohit Sharma's lbw review during Match 50 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) became a hot talking point on social media as a large section of fans were unhappy with the on-field decision being overturned.

WAVES Summit 2025 Day 2: Aamir Khan, Aishwarya Rai, Kareena's sessions in storeWAVES Summit 2025 live Day 2: PM Modi inaugurated the four-day summit in Mumbai on May 1. On the second day, celebrities including Aamir Khan, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Kareena Kapoor will take part in talk sessions.

Pak seals Wagah border, refuses to accept its own citizens cleared by IndiaStranded at their own doorstep, over a dozen Pakistanis waited at a shut Wagah gate, as Islamabad offered no explanation for refusing re-entry to their own citizens.
Will tariffs make iPhones more expensive? Tim Cook revealsApple has recently opened about the US-imposed tariff and its impact on its business.

Allu Arjun recreates Pushpa pose, admits being 1st South star with six-pack absAllu Arjun was one of the chief guests at WAVES Summit 2025 on Thursday in Mumbai. The actor recreated his iconic Pushpa pose, which received cheers from audience.

Will Akhilesh-Ambedkar poster row mar SP's Dalit votes plan?The poster, conceded by Akhilesh Yadav as a mistake, has raked up controversy at a time his party is making visible attempts to woo the Dalit electorate

Pakistan violates border ceasefire for 8th straight night, Army respondsPakistani troops continued ceasefire violations along the Line of Control for the eighth consecutive night with unprovoked firing in Kupwara, Baramulla, Poonch, Naushera, and Akhnoor areas of Jammu and Kashmir.

US Defence Secretary dials Rajnath Singh, backs India's right to defend itselfUS Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth reiterated Washington's full support for India's fight against terrorism during a conversation with Defence Minister Rajnath Singh.

GT vs SRH: Gujarat look to edge closer to playoff spot as Hyderabad on the brinkShubman Gill and Gujarat Titans will be looking to edge closer to the IPL 2025 spots as Sunrisers Hyderabad battle for survival in Ahmedabad on Friday, May 2.

Amaravati revived: All you need to know about Andhra Pradesh's capital in makingAfter years of uncertainty, development of Andhra Pradesh's capital Amaravati is back on track. Revived by Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu's 2024 return to power and fresh funding, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will relaunch the construction work.

CIA uses social media to lure Chinese spies, espionage tactics go viralThe CIA released videos in Chinese on social media asking disillusioned Chinese officials to share secrets. The clips depict fictional spies seeking freedom, as part of a wider US recruitment campaign.

West Bengal Madhyamik Class 10 results declared. Check marksheet hereThe West Bengal Board of Secondary Education (WBBSE) will declare the Madhyamik Result 2025 today, May 2, at 9 am. Students can access their Class 10 results online at India Today's official website.

sports.headline: SRH have let themselves down: Daniel Vettori gutted after poor campaignIPL 2025, GT vs SRH: Sunrisers Hyderabad head coach Daniel Vettori said that the Orange Army haven't been up to the mark and hence, are struggling at the bottom half of the table.

GT vs SRH: Gujarat look to edge closer to playoff spot as Hyderabad on the brinkShubman Gill and Gujarat Titans will be looking to edge closer to the IPL 2025 spots as Sunrisers Hyderabad battle for survival in Ahmedabad on Friday, May 2.

What's the reason behind MI's impressive IPL 2025 run? Deepak Chahar decodesDeepak Chahar feels that players coming into form at the right time has been the reason behind MI's resurgence and dream run in the IPL 2025 season. MI have moved to the top of the table with a 6-match winning run.

Does RR miss Jos Buttler in IPL 2025? Assistant coach says it's time to look aheadRR assistant coach Dishant Yagnik is saying that it is time for the franchise to look beyond Jos Buttler after releasing the England wicketkeeper ahead of IPL 2025. Royals were knocked out of the tournament after their loss to MI while Buttler and his new team GT continue to impress.

Was Suryavanshi under pressure after hundred? RR coach reacts after MI lossRR's assistant coach Dishant Yagnik has refuted claims that Vaibhav Suryavanshi was under media pressure during the MI game after scoring his maiden IPL hundred. Suryavanshi failed to impress with the bat against Mumbai on Thursday, May 1.

Nasty-fasty Jasprit Bumrah peaking at the right time for MIJasprit Bumrah bowled a fiery spell against Rajasthan on Thursday, May 1, guiding his team to the top spot of the IPL points table. Bumrah bowled some nasty bouncers in the game, which rattled the Royals batters in Jaipur.

Europa League: Manchester United thrash 10-man Athletic Bilbao, Spurs down BodoA brace from Bruno Fernandes and a goal from Casemiro in the first half saw Manchester United thrash 10-man Athletic Bilbao in the first leg of the Europa League semi-final on Thursday, May 1.

Trent Boult reveals secret behind first over wickets: Batters want a piece of meMumbai Indians (MI) fast bowler Trent Boult revealed the secret behind his first over wickets after a brilliant spell against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in Match 50 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

RR vs MI: Hardik Pandya echoes Virat Kohli's thoughts on 'batsmanship' in IPL 2025IPL 2025: Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya stressed the importance of batsmanship after their top four shone in their 100-run win over Rajasthan Royals. MI stormed to the top of the table with 14 points in 11 matches.

IPL 2025: Ruthless MI top table, knock Rajasthan Royals out of playoffs raceMumbai Indians (MI) continued their winning run in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) with a 100-run win over Rajasthan Royals (RR) at Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur. The victory extended their winning streak to six matches as they climbed to the top of the points table.

Gujarat Titans' Vikram Solanki wary of SRH's big-hitting threatGujarat Titans' director of cricket Vikram Solanki is wary of the batting threat that SunRisers Hyderabad bring with them in the IPL 2025. SRH beat CSK in their previous match of the season.

Former England football manager Gareth Southgate watches RR vs MIFormer manager of the England football team, Gareth Southgate was seen enjoying an IPL match in Jaipur. His visit coincided with Rajasthan Royals' campaign supporting women's initiatives.

RR vs MI: Rohit heaves sigh of relief as last-second DRS call helps him surviveMumbai Indians opening batter Rohit Sharma heaved a sigh of relief after a DRS call helped him survive against the Rajasthan Royals (RR) in match 50 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

RR vs MI: Sandeep misses game due to broken finger as Rajasthan make 2 changesRajasthan Royals (RR) seamer Sandeep Sharma has been ruled out of the clash against Mumbai Indians due to a broken finger. Rajasthan Royals have been forced to make two changes in the team.

Shikhar Dhawan confirms relationship with girlfriend Sophie Shine in Insta postFormer India cricketer Shikhar Dhawan and his girlfriend, Sophie Shine, confirmed their relationship with an Instagram post on Thursday, 1 May. The couple were previously spotted together during the Champions Trophy in Dubai.

Lamine Yamal deserves to win Ballon d'Or if Barcelona win UCL: Rio FerdinandFormer Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand has said that Lamine Yamal deserves to win the Ballon d'Or if he is able to guide Barcelona to a Champions League victory. Yamal was sensational in Barca's first leg of semi-final against Inter Milan.

Virender Sehwag reveals why Delhi didn't pick Virat Kohli in IPL 2008Former India cricketer and Delhi Daredevils (now Delhi Capitals) captain Virender Sehwag has revealed the real reason why Delhi didn't choose Virat Kohli in the Under-19 player's draft of the Indian Premier League 2008 (IPL 2008).

Bangladesh should have won the series vs Zimbabwe: Najmul ShantoBangladesh skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto said that the Tigers should have won the Test series against Zimbabwe. Shanto's Tigers beat the visitors by an innings and 106 runs in Chattogram.

Barely slept the night before: Suryakumar recalls Mumbai Indians debutIPL 2025: Suryakumar Yadav recalled his IPL debut for the Mumbai Indians back in 2012 against Pune Warriors. The right-handed batter recently completed 4000 runs in the IPL.

Pickleball lands in administrative war as AIPA opposes government recognition of IPAThe All India Pickleball Association (AIPA) has opposed the Sports Ministry's decision to grant National Sports Federation (NSF) status to the Indian Pickleball Association (IPA), calling the move unjustified in a letter dated April 25, 2025.

Suyash thanks RCB for life-changing hernia surgery: I used to take injectionsIPL 2025: RCB leg-spinner Suyash Sharma said how the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) helped him recover from his hernia surgeries.

Punjab Kings star Glenn Maxwell ruled out of IPL 2025 due to finger fracturePunjab Kings' Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell was ruled out of the remainder of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 season due to a fractured finger.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
